revised_title: Natural Selection on Multivariate Traits in Age-Structured Populations: A Theoretical Framework
tldr: This article presents a theoretical framework for understanding natural selection on multivariate traits in age-structured populations. It discusses the implications of selection on quantitative traits and provides a model for the change in the mean of a population under selection. The author also explores the effects of age structure and reproductive success on selection and offers insights into the dynamics of evolutionary processes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
